title: Spack aborts no matter what the command is after git merge upstream/develop
body:
Hi all,

I wanted to run with the latest spack code so I updated,  but now I can't do anything with spack.
I tried moving my $HOME/.spack files out of the way, but it didn't make a difference.
Does anyone have any insight into this?

Thanks,
Jim G

git fetch upstream

git merge upstream/develop


jeg@localhost spack]$ which spack
~/spack/bin/spack
[jeg@localhost spack]$ echo $SPACK_ROOT
/home/jeg/spack

[jeg@localhost spack]$ spack install cbtf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jeg/spack/bin/spack", line 99, in <module>
    import spack
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/__init__.py", line 74, in <module>
    import spack.repository
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 45, in <module>
    import spack.spec
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 114, in <module>
    import spack.store
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/store.py", line 47, in <module>
    import spack.config
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 208, in <module>
    _platform = spack.architecture.platform().name
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lang.py", line 187, in __call__
    self.cache[args] = self.func(*args)
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 530, in platform
    return platform_cls()
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/platforms/linux.py", line 21, in __init__
    linux_dist = LinuxDistro()
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/spack/operating_systems/linux_distro.py", line 16, in __init__
    from external.distro import linux_distribution
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/external/distro.py", line 1049, in <module>
    _distroi = LinuxDistribution()
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/external/distro.py", line 595, in __init__
    if include_lsb else {}
  File "/home/jeg/spack/lib/spack/external/distro.py", line 921, in _lsb_release_info
    out, err = out.decode('ascii'), err.decode('ascii')
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 250: ordinal not in range(128)
